translations.text: Ha'. Mim.
This is a revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate,
a Book whose verses have been well-expounded; an Arabic Qur'an for those who have knowledge,
one bearing good news and warning.<sup foot_note="181054">1</sup> Yet most of them turned away and are not wont to give heed.

They say: “Our hearts are securely wrapped up against what you call us to,<sup foot_note="181055">1</sup> and in our ears is a heaviness, and between you and us there is a veil.<sup foot_note="181056">2</sup> So act; we too are acting.”<sup foot_note="181057">3</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am only a human being like you.<sup foot_note="181058">1</sup> It is revealed to me that your God is One God;<sup foot_note="181059">2</sup> so direct yourselves straight to Him,<sup foot_note="181060">3</sup> and seek His forgiveness. Woe to those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity,<sup foot_note="181061">4</sup>
who do not pay Zakah,<sup foot_note="181062">1</sup> and who deny the Hereafter.
As to those who have faith and do good works, surely theirs shall be a never-ending reward.<sup foot_note="181063">1</sup>
Tell them, (O Prophet): “Do you indeed disbelieve in Him and assign compeers to Him Who created the earth in two days? He is the Lord of all beings of the Universe.

(After creating the earth) He set up firm mountains on it, blessed it,<sup foot_note="181064">1</sup> and provided it with sustenance in proportion to the needs of all who seek (sustenance). <sup foot_note="181065">2</sup> All this was done in four days.<sup foot_note="181066">3</sup>

Then He turned to the heaven while it was all smoke.<sup foot_note="181067">1</sup> He said to the heaven and the earth: “Come (into being), willingly or unwillingly.” They said: “Here we come (into being) in willing obeisance.”<sup foot_note="181068">2</sup>

Then He made them seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its law. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and firmly secured it.<sup foot_note="181069">1</sup> All this is the firm plan of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
But if they turn away,<sup foot_note="181070">1</sup> tell them: “I warn you against a sudden scourge like that which struck Ad and Thamud.”

When the Messengers (of Allah) came to them from the front and from the rear,<sup foot_note="181071">1</sup> saying: “Do not serve any but Allah”; they said: “Had our Lord so willed, He would have sent down angels. So we deny the Message you have brought.”<sup foot_note="181072">2</sup>

As for Ad, they waxed proud in the land without justification and said: “Who is greater than we in strength?” Did they not see that Allah, Who created them, is greater in strength than they? They continued to deny Our Signs,

whereupon We sent upon them a fierce wind on inauspicious days<sup foot_note="181073">1</sup> that We might make them taste a degrading chastisement in the life of this world.<sup foot_note="181074">2</sup> And surely the chastisement of the Hereafter is even more degrading. There will be none to help them there.
As for Thamud, We bestowed guidance upon them, but they preferred to remain blind rather than be guided. At last a humiliating scourge overtook them on account of their misdeeds.
Yet We delivered those who believed and were God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181075">1</sup>

Imagine the Day when Allah's enemies will be mustered to the Fire,<sup foot_note="181076">1</sup> and the people of the former times will be detained until the arrival of people of the later times,<sup foot_note="181077">2</sup>
and when all have arrived, their ears, their eyes, and their skins shall bear witness against them, stating all that they had done in the life of the world.<sup foot_note="181078">1</sup>

They will ask their skins: “Why did you bear witness against us?” The skins will reply: “Allah gave us speech,<sup foot_note="181079">1</sup> as He gave speech to all others. He it is Who created you for the first time and it is to Him that you will be sent back.

When you used to conceal yourselves (while committing misdeeds) you never thought that your ears or your eyes or your skins would ever bear witness against you; you rather fancied that Allah does not know a great deal of what you do.
This thought of yours about your Lord has led to your perdition and you have become among the losers.”<sup foot_note="181080">1</sup>
In this state, whether they bear with patience (or not), Fire alone shall be their abode. And if they seek to make amends, they will not be allowed to do so.<sup foot_note="181081">1</sup>

We had assigned to them companions who embellished for them all that was before them and behind them.<sup foot_note="181082">1</sup> Thus the same decree (of chastisement) which had overtaken the previous generations of jinn and human beings (also) became due against them. Surely they became the losers.
The deniers of the Truth say: “Do not give ear to the Qur'an and cause interruption when it is recited; thus perhaps you will gain the upper hand.”<sup foot_note="181083">1</sup>
We shall certainly make these unbelievers taste a terrible chastisement and shall fully requite them according to the worst deeds that they committed.
That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah � the Fire, their abiding home. That will be the re-compense for their denying Our Signs.

There the unbelievers will say: “Our Lord, show us those that led us astray, both jinn and humans, and we will trample them under our feet so that they are utterly degraded.”<sup foot_note="181084">1</sup>

Those<sup foot_note="181085">1</sup> who say “Allah is our Lord” and then remain steadfast,<sup foot_note="181086">2</sup> upon them descend angels<sup foot_note="181087">3</sup> (and say): “Do not fear nor grieve,<sup foot_note="181088">4</sup> and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.
We are your companions in this world and in the Hereafter. There you shall have all that you desire and all what you will ask for.
This is by way of hospitality from Him Who is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
And who is fairer in speech than he who calls to Allah and acts righteously and says: “I am a Muslim”?<sup foot_note="181089">1</sup>

(O Prophet), good and evil are not equal. Repel (evil) with that which is good, and you will see that he, between whom and you there was enmity, shall become as if he were a bosom friend (of yours).<sup foot_note="181090">1</sup>
But none attains to this except those who are steadfast;<sup foot_note="181091">1</sup> none attains to this except those endowed with mighty good fortune.<sup foot_note="181092">2</sup>
And if you are prompted by a provocation from Satan, seek refuge with Allah.<sup foot_note="181093">1</sup> He, and He alone, is All-Hearing, All- Knowing.<sup foot_note="181094">2</sup>

And<sup foot_note="181095">1</sup> of His Signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon.<sup foot_note="181096">2</sup> Do not prostrate yourselves before the sun, nor before the moon, but prostrate yourselves before Allah Who created them, if it is Him that you serve.<sup foot_note="181097">3</sup>

But if they wax proud<sup foot_note="181098">1</sup> (and persist in their attitude, it does not matter, for) the angels near-stationed to your Lord glorify Him night and day, and never grow weary.<sup foot_note="181099">2</sup>

And of His Signs is that you see the earth withered, then We send down water upon it, and lo! it quivers and swells. Surely He Who gives life to the dead earth will also give life to the dead.<sup foot_note="181100">1</sup> Surely He has power over everything.

Those<sup foot_note="181101">1</sup> who pervert Our Signs<sup foot_note="181102">2</sup> are not hidden from Us.<sup foot_note="181103">3</sup> Is he who will be cast into the Fire better, or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you wish; He sees all what you do.
These are the ones who rejected the Good Counsel when it came to them, although it is certainly a Mighty Book.<sup foot_note="181104">1</sup>
Falsehood may not enter it from the front or from the rear.<sup foot_note="181105">1</sup> It is a revelation that has been sent down from the Most Wise, the Immensely Praiseworthy.

(O Prophet), nothing is said to you but what was already said to the Messengers before you. Surely your Lord is the Lord of forgiveness<sup foot_note="181106">1</sup> and the Lord of grievous chastisement.

Had We revealed this as a non-Arabic Qur'an they would have said: “Why were its verses not clearly expounded? How strange, a non-Arabic scripture and an Arab audience!”<sup foot_note="181107">1</sup> Tell them: “It is a guidance and a healing to the believers. But to those who do not believe, it serves as a plug in their ears and a covering over their eyes. It is as if they are being called from a place far away.<sup foot_note="181108">2</sup>

And in the past We gave Moses the Book and yet it became an object of dispute.<sup foot_note="181109">1</sup> If your Lord's decree had not gone forth before, a decisive judgement would have been made among them, once and for all.<sup foot_note="181110">2</sup> Surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.<sup foot_note="181111">3</sup>
Whoever does good, does so to his own benefit; and whoever does evil, will suffer its evil consequence. Your Lord does no wrong to His servants.<sup foot_note="181112">1</sup>

The knowledge of the Hour<sup foot_note="181113">1</sup> rests solely with Him.<sup foot_note="181114">2</sup> Not a fruit comes forth from its sheath, nor does any female conceive nor give birth to a child but it is in His knowledge.<sup foot_note="181115">3</sup> On that Day He will call out to them: “Where are those associates of Mine?” They will answer: “We have declared to You that none of us can bear witness to that.”<sup foot_note="181116">4</sup>
Then all those deities whom they once used to call upon shall vanish<sup foot_note="181117">1</sup> and they will come to know for sure that there is no escape for them.
Man wearies not of praying for good,<sup foot_note="181118">1</sup> but when evil visits him, he despairs and gives up all hope.

And if We bestow Our Mercy upon him after hardship, he will surely say: “This is what I truly deserve,<sup foot_note="181119">1</sup> and I do not believe that the Hour (of Resurrection) will ever come to pass; and if I am returned to my Lord, there too I shall enjoy the best.” Surely We shall fully apprise the unbelievers of what they have done, and We shall certainly make them taste a severe chastisement.
When We bestow Our favour upon man, he turns away and waxes proud;<sup foot_note="181120">1</sup> but when a misfortune touches him, he is full of supplication.<sup foot_note="181121">2</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “Did you ever consider: if this Qur'an is indeed from Allah and you still deny it, who can be in greater error than he who goes far in fiercely opposing it?”<sup foot_note="181122">1</sup>

Soon shall We show them Our Signs on the horizons and in their own beings until it becomes clear to them that it is the Truth.<sup foot_note="181123">1</sup> Is it not enough that your Lord is a witness over everything?<sup foot_note="181124">2</sup>
Lo, they are in doubt concerning their meeting with their Lord.<sup foot_note="181125">1</sup> Surely He fully encompasses everything.<sup foot_note="181126">2</sup>
